page.title: List of presidential trips made by Barack Obama during 2011

revision.text:
{{main|Presidency of Barack Obama}} [[File:Obama Tucson Memorial 2011.jpg|thumb|President Obama with [[First Lady of the United States|First Lady]] [[Michelle Obama]] in January 2011, at the memorial service in [[Tucson, Arizona]] for the victims of the [[2011 Tucson shooting|Tucson shooting]].]] This is a '''list of presidential trips made by [[Barack Obama]] during 2011''', the third year of [[Presidency of Barack Obama|his presidency]] as the [[List of Presidents of the United States|44th]] [[President of the United States]]. This list excludes trips made within [[Washington, D.C.]], the U.S. federal capital in which the [[White House]], the official residence and principal workplace of the President, is located. Additionally excluded are trips to [[Camp David]], the country residence of the President, and to the private home of the [[Family of Barack Obama|Obama family]] in [[Kenwood, Chicago]], [[Illinois]]. ==January== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited !width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{Flag icon|Arizona}} ''[[Arizona]]'' |[[Tucson, Arizona|Tucson]] |January 12 |President Obama attended the memorial service for the victims of the [[2011 Tucson shooting|Tucson shooting]]. He made his first stop at [[University Medical Center (Tucson, Arizona)|University Medical Center]], where he saw [[United States House of Representatives|Congresswoman]] [[Gabrielle Giffords]], who was critically injured in the attack. He then visited four other wounded patients, before meeting the families of those killed in the attack. At the memorial service itself at the [[University of Arizona]] sports arena, President Obama made [[Barack Obama speech at Tucson memorial|a widely praised speech]] calling for a more civil political environment.{{cite news |url= https://www.theguardian.com/world/2011/jan/13/barack-obama-arizona-shooting-address|title= Barack Obama visits Arizona shooting survivors before memorial address|author= Chris McGreal and Ed Pilkington|date= 13 January 2011|work= The Guardian|publisher= |accessdate=14 January 2011|location=London}}{{cite news |url= https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE70C05E20110113|title= Obama leads Arizona memorial service|author= Jeff Mason and Tim Gaynor|date= 12 January 2011|agency= Reuters|publisher= |accessdate=14 January 2011}}{{cite news |url= http://thecaucus.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/01/13/praise-for-obama-from-the-right-and-left/?partner=rss&emc=rss|title= Praise for Obama, From the Right and Left|author= Michael D. Shear|date= 13 January 2011|work= The Caucus |publisher= The New York Times|accessdate=14 January 2011}}{{cite web |url= https://vancouversun.com/news/Obama+earns+country+praise/4107111/story.html|title= Obama earns a country's praise|author= Sheldon Alberts|date= 14 January 2011|work= The Vancouver Sun|publisher= |accessdate=14 January 2011}} |- |{{Flag icon|New York}} ''[[New York (state)|New York]]'' |[[Albany, New York|Albany]], [[Schenectady, New York|Schenectady]] |January 21 |President Obama arrived at [[Albany International Airport]] before visiting a [[General Electric]] facility in [[Schenectady, New York]], where he made a speech to around 400 workers concerning economic recovery. Among those who accompanied Obama was [[United States Senate|Senator]] [[Kirsten Gillibrand]].{{cite web |url= http://www.timesunion.com/local/article/Obama-lights-up-GE-Schenectady-969707.php|title= Obama lights up GE, Schenectady|author=|date= 21 January 2011|work= Times Union|publisher= |accessdate=24 January 2011}}{{cite web |url= http://www.dailygazette.com/news/2011/jan/19/0119_obama/|title= Obama expected to arrive around noon; Tonko, Gillibrand will be on plane|author= David Lombardo|date= 19 January 2011|work= The Daily Gazette|publisher= |accessdate=24 January 2011}} |- |{{Flag icon|Wisconsin}} ''[[Wisconsin]]'' |[[Manitowoc, Wisconsin|Manitowoc]] |January 26 |A day after his [[2011 State of the Union Address|State of the Union address]], President Obama visited the headquarters of power technology company [[Orion Energy Systems, Inc.]] in [[Manitowoc, Wisconsin]]. In a speech, Obama called for the U.S. to "up [its] game" in a time of increasing global competition. The decision to make [[Wisconsin]] the first state Obama visited following his State of the Union address was seen as making political sense, given the upcoming [[United States presidential election, 2012|2012 presidential election]] and the state's central position in the "[[Midwestern United States|Midwest]] battleground".{{cite web |url= https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-01-26/obama-says-u-s-needs-to-up-game-to-compete-in-shift-to-business-agenda.html|title= Obama Says U.S. Needs to `Up Game' to Compete in Shift to Business Agenda|author= Kate Andersen Brower|date= 26 January 2011|work= Bloomberg|publisher= |accessdate=26 January 2011}}{{cite web |url= http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/Obama/president-obama-push-jobs-economy-wisconsin-post-state/story?id=12753842|title= Wisconsin Ground Zero for 2012 Election|author= John R. Parkinson|date= 25 January 2011|work= ABC News|publisher= |accessdate=26 January 2011}} |} ==February== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited !width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{Flag icon|California}} ''[[California]]'' |[[Woodside, California|Woodside]] |February 17 |President Obama visited the home of Silicon Valley venture capitalist [[John Doerr]], a campaign donor. He met with the Silicon Valley CEOs, including [[Steve Jobs]], [[Mark Zuckerberg]], [[Eric Schmidt]], [[Larry Ellison]], and [[Dick Costolo]], and discussed economic issues.{{Cite news|title=Obama meets with Silicon Valley tech elite |date=17 February 2011 |accessdate=9 April 2011 |publisher=Silicon Valley Mercury News |url=http://www.mercurynews.com/business/ci_17415024}} |- |{{Flag icon|Oregon}} ''[[Oregon]]'' |[[Hillsboro, Oregon|Hillsboro]] |February 18 |President Obama visited the [[Intel]] campus in Hillsboro. He toured a [[semiconductor]] facility and hosted a forum with CEO [[Paul Otellini]].{{Cite news|title=Obama speaks at Intel campus in Hillsboro about education, high-tech needs |date=18 February 2011 |accessdate=9 April 2011 |publisher=Oregon Live |url=http://www.oregonlive.com/politics/index.ssf/2011/02/obama_speaks_at_intel_campus_i.html}} |- |{{Flag icon|Ohio}} ''[[Ohio]]'' |[[Cleveland, Ohio|Cleveland]] |February 22 |President Obama visited [[Cleveland State University]] with members of his cabinet to host a forum on small business as the first part of his "Winning the Future" tour. He visited the [[favela]] [[Cidade de Deus (Rio de Janeiro)|Cidade de Deus]], one of Rio de Janeiro's most impoverished and famous neighborhoods.{{Cite news|title=President Underscores Similarities With Brazilians, but Sidesteps One |date=20 March 2011 |accessdate=22 April 2011 |publisher=The New York Times |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/03/21/world/americas/21brazil.html?_r=2&ref=americas |first1=Alexei |last1=Barrionuevo |first2=Jackie |last2=Calmes}} He then went with his family to visit the [[Christ the Redeemer (statue)|Christ the Redeemer]] statue. ''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited !width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{Flag icon|Maryland}} ''[[Maryland]]'' |[[Landover, Maryland|Landover]] |April 1 |President Obama visited a [[United Parcel Service|UPS]] [[distribution center]] to urge companies to switch their fleets to more fuel efficient vehicles. He highlighted the fact that UPS, [[AT&T]], [[FedEx]], [[PepsiCo]] and [[Verizon]] have signed on to the administration's voluntary program called the National Clean Fleets Partnership. Half a dozen electric vehicles from the companies were on display.{{cite web |url= http://weblogs.baltimoresun.com/news/local/politics/2011/04/obama_visits_to_landover_to_di.html|title= Obama comes to Md. to tout clean cars|author= John Fritze|date= 1 April 2011|work= The Baltimore Sun|publisher= |accessdate=9 April 2011}} |- |{{Flag icon|Pennsylvania}} ''[[Pennsylvania]]'' |[[Fairless Hills, Pennsylvania|Fairless Hills]] |April 6 |President Obama visited the [[Gamesa]] [[wind turbine]] plant. news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-13166265|title=Why are US presidents so keen to be Irish?|date=26 April 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=25 May 2011}} After returning from 2011|publisher=Independent.ie News|accessdate=29 May 2011}} |- |{{Flag icon|United Kingdom}} [[United Kingdom]] |[[London]] |May 23–26 |President Obama arrived a day ahead of schedule on Monday 23 to avoid any disruption from a [[2011 eruption of Grímsvötn|volcanic ash cloud in Iceland]]. During the first official day of his UK [[state visit]], Obama received a ceremonial welcome, including a 41-gun salute, at the [[Garden at Buckingham Palace]]. Obama toured [[Buckingham Palace|the palace]] and met [[British royal family|senior royals]] there before traveling to [[10 Downing Street]], where he met Prime Minister [[David Cameron]] and his wife [[Samantha Cameron|Samantha]]. The president also met [[Leader of the Opposition (United Kingdom)|opposition leader]] [[Ed Miliband]] and visited to the Globe Academy in [[Southwark]], south London, where Obama and Cameron teamed up for a table tennis match against schoolboys. Obama also laid a wreath on the [[The Unknown Warrior|Tomb of the Unknown Warrior]] in [[Westminster Abbey]] and attended a state banquet at Buckingham Palace hosted by Queen [[Elizabeth II]]. On the second day of the state, Obama met with Prime Minister Cameron and [[Deputy Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|Deputy Prime Minister]] [[Nick Clegg]] and served up food at a barbecue for military families from the U.S. and Britain in the Downing Street garden. Cameron and Obama hold later a joint press conference at [[Lancaster House]]. Obama gave a speech at [[Westminster Hall]] to the UK Parliament and later hosted a banquet for the Queen, [[Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh|Prince Philip]] and a select group of other guests at [[Winfield House]] (the U.S. ambassador's residence) in London. Obama departed London on May 26 en route to the G8 Summit in Deauville, France.{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/national-news/presidential-visit/united-by-irish-triumphs-obama-meets-the-queen-2656333.html|title=United by Irish triumphs Obama meets the Queen|date=24 May 2011|publisher=independent.ie|accessdate=29 May 2011|first=Tony|last=Jones}}{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-13506898|title=Queen greets President Obama on first UK state visit|date=24 May 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=29 May 2011}}{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/in-pictures-13518697|title=In pictures: Obama state visit to the UK|date=24 May 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=29 May 2011}}{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/in-pictures-13540042|title=In pictures: Obama state visit - day two|date=25 May 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=29 May 2011}}{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-13546626|title=Analysis: What Obama visit says about UK-US alliance|date=25 May 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=29 May 2011}}{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-13549927|title=Obama's speech to UK Parliament, in full, with analysis|date=25 May 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=29 May 2011}} |- |{{Flag icon|France}} [[France]] |[[Deauville]] |May 26–27 |Obama attended the [[37th G8 summit]] in [[Deauville]] where he had bilateral talks with the [[President of Russia]], [[Dmitry Medvedev]], the [[Prime Minister of Japan]], [[Naoto Kan]], and the [[President of France]], [[Nicolas Sarkozy]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-13554836|title=G8 summit: Arab uprisings dominate Deauville agenda|date=26 May 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=2 June 2011}}{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-13558020|title=In pictures: G8 summit|date=26 May 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=2 June 2011}}{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-13572830|title=G8: Libya's Gaddafi 'should go', say world leaders|date=27 May 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=2 June 2011}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/05/27/world/europe/27prexy.html|title=Obama Seeks Aid for Egypt and Tunisia at Meeting|date=26 May 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=2 June 2011|first=Mark|last=Landler}} |- |{{Flag icon|Poland}} [[Poland]] |[[Warsaw]] |May 27–28 |On Day One of his two-day visit Obama participated in wreath laying ceremonies at both the [[Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, Warsaw|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier]] and the Warsaw Ghetto Memorial. The President also met with Jewish community leaders and Holocaust survivors at the Warsaw Ghetto Memorial. At the evening of Day One he also participated a dinner with Central and Eastern European leaders hosted by Polish President Bronislaw Komorowski at the [[Royal Castle, Warsaw|Royal Castle]]. On Day Two of his visit Obama had meetings with President [[Bronisław Komorowski]] and Prime Minister [[Donald Tusk]]. He also visited the memorial to the victims of the [[Smolensk plane crash]] at the Field Cathedral of the Polish Military in Warsaw.{{cite news|url=http://www.capitolhillwomen.com/2011/05/wrapping-up-the-g-8-summit-and-heading-to-poland/|title=Wrapping Up the G-8 Summit and Heading to Poland|date=27 May 2011|publisher=Capitol Hill |{{Flag icon|Australia}} [[Australia]] |[[Canberra]], [[Darwin, Northern Territory|Darwin]] |November 16–17 |The two-day visit was President Obama's first official visit to Australia—previously scheduled trips were canceled due to the passage of the [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]] and the [[Deepwater Horizon oil spill|Gulf of Mexico oil spill]]. The aim of the visit was to strengthen the [[Australian American relations]] and promoting security in the Pacific. On Wednesday 16, the President met with [[Australian Prime Minister]] [[Julia Gillard]], and the two held a joint press conference in which an increase in U.S. military presence in northern Australia was announced. Later on that day President Obama was hosted at a supper at the Australian Parliament Residence. On Thursday 17, the President spoke to the [[Parliament of Australia|Australian Parliament]] at [[Parliament House, Canberra|Parliament House]], meet with parliamentary leaders, toured a major college with Prime Minister Gillard, and then traveled to Darwin to commemorate the 60th anniversary of the [[ANZUS]] alliance. In Darwin participated in a wreath laying ceremony with Prime Minister Gillard at [[USS Peary (DD-226)#Memorial|USS Peary Memorial]] and delivered remarks to Australian troops and U.S. Marines. During his stay in Australia Obama also participated in a wreath laying ceremony at the [[Australian War Memorial]], met with Opposition Leader [[Tony Abbott]], and held a U.S. Embassy meet and greet at the U.S. Embassy in Canberra, where he also participated in a tree dedication ceremony.{{cite news|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2011-11-16/obama-to-land-in-australia-this-afternoon/3673782|title=Obama visit to focus on military ties|publisher=ABC News (Australian Broadcasting Corporation|date=16 November 2011|accessdate=16 November 2011}}{{cite news|url= https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U8x8_rXJFzo|title=Obama paves way for Australia-US base|publisher=AlJazeeraEnglish|date=15 November 2011|accessdate=17 November 2011}}{{cite news|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1123G3EjuNg|title=Obama boosts US military links with Australia|publisher=AlJazeeraEnglish|date=16 November 2011|accessdate=17 November 2011}}{{cite news|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f_ZBOBOLptY|title=Obama cements ties with Australia|publisher=AlJazeeraEnglish|date=17 November 2011|accessdate=3 April 2012}}{{cite news |title=Obama, denying fear of China, boosts U.S. military presence in Australia |author=Ben Feller |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/obama-boosts-us-military-presence-in-australia/article2237712/ |agency=Associated Press |date=November 16, 2011 |accessdate=November 18, 2011 |location=Toronto}}{{cite news |title=Obama Increases Military Presence in Australia |author=Erik Hayden |url=http://www.theatlanticwire.com/global/2011/11/obama-increases-military-presence-australia/45043/ |newspaper=The Atlantic Wire |date=November 16, 2011 |accessdate=November 18, 2011}}{{cite news |title=Obama: US to boost Asia-Pacific military presence|url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/45318987/ns/politics-white_house/t/obama-us-boost-asia-pacific-military-presence/ |newspaper=msnbc.com news services|date=November 17, 2011 |accessdate=November 18, 2011}}{{cite news |title=Obama to renew, strengthen ties in Australia |url=http://www.worldbulletin.net/?aType=haber&ArticleID=81684|agency=Reuters |date=November 16, 2011 |accessdate=November 18, 2011}}{{cite news |title=China reproaches Australia over strengthened US defence ties|author=Ben Packham|url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/national-affairs/obama-in-australia/our-indispensable-alliance-barack-obama/story-fnb0o39u-1226197460882|newspaper=The Australian |date=November 17, 2011 |accessdate=November 19, 2011}}{{cite news |title=A U.S. Marine Base for Australia Irritates Chinas|author=Jackie Calmes|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/11/17/world/asia/obama-and-gillard-expand-us-australia-military-ties.html?ref=asia|newspaper=The New York Times|date=November 16, 2011 |accessdate=November 25, 2011}}{{cite news |title=Obama Addresses Troops at Final Stop in Australia|author=Jackie Calmes|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/11/18/world/asia/obama-addresses-troops-at-final-stop-in-australia.html?pagewanted=1&ref=asia|newspaper=The New York Times|date=November 17, 2011 |accessdate=November 25, 2011}}{{cite news |title=Does the U.S. Need Troops in Australia?|url=https://www.nytimes.com/roomfordebate/2011/11/21/does-the-us-need-troops-in-australia|newspaper=The New York Times|date=November 21, 2011 |accessdate=November 25, 2011}}{{cite news |title=U.S. troops headed to Australia, irking China |author=David Nakamura |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia_pacific/us-troops-headed-to-australia-irking-china/2011/11/16/gIQAiGiuRN_story.html |newspaper=Washington Post |date=November 16, 2011 |accessdate=April 5, 2012}} |- |{{Flag icon|Indonesia}} [[Indonesia]] |[[Nusa Dua]]{{cite news |title=Gillard keen to reassure China on US presence |author= |url=http://www.smh.com.au/national/gillard-keen-to-reassure-china-on-us-presence-20111119-1noaa.html |newspaper=The Sydney Morning Herald |date=November 19, 2011 |accessdate=April 8, 2012}} on [[Bali]] |November 17–19 |President Obama attended the annual [[ASEAN Summit]] and the [[Sixth East Asia Summit]] on Bali. During his stay in Bali Obama participated in an event to announce a commercial deal with representatives of [[Boeing]] and [[Lion Air]], participated in Embassy and U.S. Mission Meet & Greet and hosted bilateral meeting with Prime Minister [[Manmohan Singh|Singh]] of [[India]], President [[Benigno Aquino III|Aquino]] of the [[Philippines]], President [[Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono|Yudhoyono]] of Indonesia as well as Prime Minister [[Yingluck Shinawatra|Yingluck]] of [[Thailand]]. The President also announced that U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Clinton plans to visit Myanmar in December 2011 on a trip that could signal a major change in [[Burma – United States relations#United States|relations between the two countries]]. On Bali President Obama also had an unscheduled meeting with Chinese Prime Minister [[Wen Jiabao]].{{cite news |title=East Asian Summit: Obama's Asia reboot puts India in pivotal, but risky position|author=Jason Overdorf|url=http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/regions/asia-pacific/india/111118/east-asian-summit-obamas-asia-reboot-puts-india-pivo|newspaper=GlobalPost|date=November 17, 2011 |accessdate=November 25, 2011}}{{cite news |title=India, US looking to counter China at Asian summit|author=Jason Overdorf|url=http://www.globalpost.com/dispatches/globalpost-blogs/the-rice-bowl/india-us-looking-counter-china-at-asian-summit|newspaper=GlobalPost|date=November 17, 2011 |accessdate=November 25, 2011}}{{cite news |title=Is China threatened by a more open Burma?|author=Kathleen E. McLaughlin|url=http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/regions/asia-pacific/china/111123/burma-myanmar-hillary-clinton-diplomacy|newspaper=GlobalPost|date=November 24, 2011 |accessdate=November 25, 2011}}{{cite news |title=Obama’s Asia trip: bold and successful|author=Philipp S. Balboni|url=http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/opinion/111121/barack-obama-US-elections-2012|newspaper=GlobalPost|date=November 22, 2011 |accessdate=November 25, 2011}}{{cite news |title=Tournament of shadows|author=C. Raja Mohan|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/tournament-of-shadows/876901/0|newspaper=Indian Express|date=November 17, 2011 |accessdate=November 25, 2011}}{{cite news |title=Obama, Wen Jiabao talk economics, South China Sea|author=Keith B. Richburg|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia_pacific/obama-wen-jiabao-discuss-economics-south-china-sea/2011/11/19/gIQAxZSwaN_story.html|newspaper=The Washington Post|date=November 19, 2011 |accessdate=November 25, 2011}}{{cite news |title=Barack Obama, Wen Jiabao discuss economic topics in a surprise lawmakers to back extension of payroll tax cut |publisher=''[[The Dallas Morning News]]'' |date=22 November 2011 |accessdate=20 January 2012}} |- |{{flagicon|Pennsylvania}} ''[[Pennsylvania]]'' |url=http://www.utsandiego.com/news/2011/nov/30/obama-pushes-gop-to-extend-payroll-tax-cuts/ |title=Obama pushes GOP to extend payroll tax cuts |first=Jim |last=Kuhnhenn |date=30 November 2011 Trip To Push Tax Cut Extension}} |- |{{flagicon|New York}} ''[[New York (state)|New York]]'' |[[New York City]] |November 30 |President Obama traveled to New York City to campaign and raise funds, including a fundraiser at the Gotham Bar & Grill.{{cite news |url=http://www.atimes.com/atimes/Global_Economy/ML16Dj02.html |title=Their bread, our circus |first=Tom |last=Engelhardt |publisher=[[Asia Times Online]] |date=16 December 2011 |accessdate=20 January 2012}} |} ==References== {{Reflist|35em}} {{Barack Obama}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Presidential Trips Made By Barack Obama during 2011}} [[Category:2011 in the United States]] [[Category:Presidential travels of Barack Obama]] [[Category:Lists of events in the United States]] [[Category:Geography-related lists]] [[Category:2011-related lists]] [[Category:2011 in international relations]]

page.title: List of presidential trips made by Barack Obama during 2014

revision.text:
{{main|Presidency of Barack Obama}} [[File:Barack Obama and Shinzo Abe at Sukyabashi Jiro April 2014.jpg|thumb|Obama dining with Japanese Prime Minister [[Shinzō Abe]] at [[Sukiyabashi Jiro]] during his visit to [[Tokyo]], Japan, April 23, 2014]] This is a '''list of presidential trips made by [[Barack Obama]] during 2014''', the sixth year of [[Presidency of Barack Obama|his presidency]] as the [[List of Presidents of the United States|44th]] [[President of the United States]]. This list excludes trips made within [[Washington, D.C.]], the U.S. federal capital in which the [[White House]], the official residence and principal workplace of the President, is located. Additionally excluded are trips to [[Camp David]], the country residence of the President, and to the private home of the [[Family of Barack Obama|Obama family]] in [[Kenwood, Chicago|Kenwood]], [[Chicago]]. ==January== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{Flagicon|North Carolina}} ''[[North Carolina]]'' |[[Raleigh, North Carolina|Raleigh]] |January 15 |President Obama toured [[Vacon]] facilities and delivered remarks at the [[North Carolina State University]], regarding manufacturing jobs.{{cite web|last1=Slack|first1=Megan|title=North Carolina Is Home to America’s Newest High-Tech Manufacturing Hub|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/blog/2014/01/15/north-carolina-home-america-s-newest-high-tech-manufacturing-hub|website=[[WhiteHouse.gov]]|accessdate=March 28, 2015|date=January 15, 2014}}{{cite news|title=President Obama announces new Raleigh-based manufacturing institute during North Carolina visit|url=http://abc11.com/politics/obama-unveils-plan-for-nc-innovation-hub/34877/|accessdate=March 28, 2015|publisher=[[WTVD]]|date=January 15, 2014}} |- |{{Flagicon|Pennsylvania}} ''[[Pennsylvania]]'' |[[Pittsburgh]] |January 29 |President Obama signed the [[myRA|''my''RA]] program and delivered remarks at [[U.S. Steel]]'s [[Mon Valley Works–Irvin Plant|Irvin plant]].{{cite news|last1=O'Toole|first1=James|title=President Obama delivers speech in West Mifflin|url=http://www.post-gazette.com/local/south/2014/01/29/President-Obama-land-in-Pittsburgh-headed-to-West-Mifflin/stories/201401290121|accessdate=March 28, 2015|publisher=''[[Pittsburgh Post-Gazette]]''|date=January 29, 2014}} |- |{{Flagicon|Wisconsin}} ''[[Wisconsin]]'' |[[Milwaukee]] |January 30 |President Obama visited [[General Electric]]'s Gas Engine Plant, where he delivered a speech regarding jobs and minimum wage.{{cite news|title=UPDATE: President Obama stops in Waukesha|url=http://www.nbc15.com/news/headlines/Pres-Obama-to-visit-Wisconsin-after-address-242242731.html|accessdate=March 28, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=[[WMTV]]|date=January 30, 2014}} |- |{{Flagicon|Tennessee}} ''[[Tennessee]]'' |[[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]] |January 30 |President Obama delivered a speech on education at [[McGavock High School]].{{cite news|last1=Gang|first1=Duane W.|title=Obama pushes education in Nashville|url=http://archive.tennessean.com/article/20140130/NEWS/301300140/Obama-pushes-education-Nashville|accessdate=March 28, 2014|publisher=''[[The Tennessean]]''|date=January 30, 2014}} |} ==February== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|Michigan}} ''[[Michigan]]'' |[[Lansing, Michigan|Lansing]],
[[East Lansing, Michigan|East Lansing]] |February 7 |President Obama toured the Michigan Biotechnology Institute in Lansing and signed the [[Agricultural Act of 2014]] at the [[Michigan State University]] in East Lansing.{{cite news|last1=Pickler|first1=Nedra|title=Obama signs farm bill that trims food stamps|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/ap/article-2553724/Obama-signs-farm-bill-trims-food-stamps.html|accessdate=March 28, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[Daily Mail]]''|date=February 7, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Virginia}} ''[[Virginia]]'' |[[Charlottesville, Virginia|Charlottesville]] |February 10 |President Obama took [[President of France|French President]] [[François Hollande]] on a trip to [[Monticello]], the residence of third President and [[Founding Fathers of the United States|Founding Father]] [[Thomas Jefferson]], who had served as a [[United States Ambassador to France|United States Minister to France]].{{cite news|last1=McCarthy|first1=Tom|title=Obama hosts French president François Hollande on state visit|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/feb/10/obama-french-president-francois-hollande-live|accessdate=March 28, 2015|publisher=''[[The Guardian]]''|date=February 10, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Maryland}} ''[[Maryland]]'' |[[Cambridge, Maryland|Cambridge]] |February 14 |President Obama spoke about [[Minimum wage in the United States|minimum wage]] increase and [[Immigration to the United States|immigration]] at the [[Democratic Caucus of the United States House of Representatives|House Democratic]] Issues Conference.{{cite news|last1=Babington|first1=Charles|title=Minimum wage increase, immigration overhaul top Obama’s agenda|url=https://www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/minimum-wage-increases-immigration-overhaul-top-obamas-agenda/|accessdate=March 28, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[PBS NewsHour]]''|date=February 15, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|California}} ''[[California]]'' |[[Fresno, California|Fresno]],
[[Palm Springs, California|Palm Springs]] |February 14–17 |In Fresno, President Obama met with community leaders during a [[Round table (discussion)|round table discussion]] to discuss the [[2012–15 North American drought]], before meeting with farmers affected by the drought, where he announced a $183 million aid for drought relief programs in California.{{cite news|last1=Onishi|first1=Norimitsu|last2=Davenport|first2=Coral|title=Obama Announces Aid for Drought-Stricken California|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/02/15/us/politics/obama-to-announce-aid-for-drought-racked-california.html?_r=0|accessdate=March 28, 2015|publisher=''[[The New York Times]]''|date=February 14, 2014}} In Palm Springs, President Obama met with [[Abdullah II of Jordan|King Abdullah II]] of [[Jordan]] at the [[Sunnylands]] estate to discuss the [[Israeli–Palestinian peace process]] and the [[Syrian Civil War]].{{cite news|last1=Newkirk|first1=Barrett|last2=Kelman|first2=Brett|last3=Felci|first3=Erica|title=Jordan's king in Calif. to meet with Obama|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2014/02/13/jordans-king-in-calif-to-meet-with-obama/5471637/|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=''[[The Desert Sun]]''|date=February 13, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Mexico}} [[Mexico]] |[[Toluca]] |February 19 |President Obama met with [[Prime Minister of Canada|Canadian Prime Minister]] [[Stephen Harper]] and [[President of Mexico|Mexican President]] [[Enrique Peña Nieto]] at the [[North American Leaders' Summit]] to discuss commerce, energy, immigration, and trade.{{cite news|title=Obama’s agenda criticized ahead of Mexico trade talks|url=http://america.aljazeera.com/articles/2014/2/19/obama-s-agenda-criticizedaheadofmexicosummit.html|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=[[Al Jazeera America]]|date=February 19, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Minnesota}} ''[[Minnesota]]'' |[[Saint Paul, Minnesota|Saint Paul]] |February 26 |President Obama delivered remarks at the [[Saint Paul Union Depot]] regarding the investment of infrastructure improvement.{{cite news|last1=Zdechlik|first1=Mark|title=In Minn., Obama pitches $300B infrastructure plan|url=http://www.mprnews.org/story/2014/02/26/obama-seeking-300-billion-for-roads-railways|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=[[Minnesota Public Radio]]|date=February 26, 2014}} |} ==March== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|Connecticut}} ''[[Connecticut]]'' |[[New Britain, Connecticut|New Britain]] |March 5 |President Obama delivered remarks at the [[Central Connecticut State University]] regarding the need to increase the [[Minimum wage in the United States#Federal|federal minimum wage]].{{cite news|last1=Brandon|first1=Heather|title=President Obama Visits Connecticut, in Tweets|url=http://wnpr.org/post/president-obama-visits-connecticut-tweets|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=[[Connecticut Public Radio]]|date=March 5, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Massachusetts}} ''[[Massachusetts]]'' |[[Boston]] |March 5 |President Obama attended a round table discussion fundraiser for the [[Democratic National Committee]], before attending a dinner with the committee at [[Artists for Humanity#The Artists For Humanity EpiCenter|The Artists For Humanity EpiCenter]].{{cite news|title=Obama visiting Boston, Cambridge for Democratic fundraisers|url=http://www.myfoxboston.com/story/24892040/2014/03/05/obama-to-visit-boston-for-democratic-fundraisers|accessdate=March 29, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=[[WFXT]]|date=March 5, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Florida}} ''[[Florida]]'' |[[Miami]] |March 7 |President Obama and [[First Lady of the United States|First Lady]] [[Michelle Obama]] visited the [[Coral Reef Senior High School]], where the President spoke about the [[FAFSA]].{{cite news|title=President Obama visits South Florida high school|url=http://www.wsvn.com/story/24917786/president-obama-visits-south-florida-high-school|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=[[WSVN]]|date=March 8, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|New York}} ''[[New York (state)|New York]]'' |[[New York City]] |March 11 |President Obama visited the [[Gap Inc.|Gap]] store in [[Midtown Manhattan]] to acknowledge the company's increase in minimum wage.{{cite news|last1=Durkin|first1=Erin|last2=Burke|first2=Kerry|last3=Golgowski|first3=Nina|title=President Obama makes shopping stop at New York Gap as part of minimum wage campaign|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/new-york/obama-unscheduled-trip-gap-part-min-wage-campaign-article-1.1718211|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=''[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]''|date=March 11, 2014}} The President also attended two fundraising events for the Democratic National Committee.{{cite news|title=Obama, Clinton Fundraising Circles Overlap In Push To End DNC Deficit|url=http://washington.cbslocal.com/2014/03/11/obama-clinton-fundraising-circles-overlap-in-push-to-end-dnc-deficit/|accessdate=March 29, 2014|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=[[CBS]]|date=March 11, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Maryland}} ''[[Maryland]]'' |[[Bethesda, Maryland|Bethesda]] |March 17 |President Obama met with injured troops and their families at the [[Walter Reed National Military Medical Center]].{{cite news|title=President Obama's schedule for Monday, March 17|url=http://www.upi.com/Top_News/US/2014/03/17/President-Obamas-schedule-for-Monday-March-17/87761395055914/|accessdate=March 29, 2015|agency=[[United Press International]]|date=March 17, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Florida}} ''[[Florida]]'' |[[Orlando, Florida|Orlando]],
[[Miami]] |March 20 |In Orlando, President Obama met with female students during a round table discussion at [[Valencia College]], before delivering a speech about the need for equal payment and educational opportunities for women.{{cite news|title=Obama calls for equal pay for women in Valencia College speech|url=http://www.wesh.com/politics/obama-to-give-economic-speech-at-valencia-college/25067460|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=[[WESH]]|date=March 21, 2014}} In Miami, President Obama attended two fundraising events for the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]].{{cite news|last1=Pastrana|first1=Lauren|title=President Obama Stops In Miami For Fundraiser|url=http://miami.cbslocal.com/2014/03/20/president-obama-back-in-miami-for-fundraiser/|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=[[CBS]]|date=March 20, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Netherlands}} [[Netherlands]] |[[Amsterdam]],
[[The Hague]] |March 24–26 |In Amsterdam, President Obama toured the [[Rijksmuseum]], where a bilateral meeting with [[Prime Minister of the Netherlands|Prime Minister]] [[Mark Rutte]] was held, before attending the [[2014 Nuclear Security Summit|Nuclear Security Summit]] at the [[World Forum (The Hague)|World Forum]] in The Hague on March 24 and 25. The President also met with [[G7]] leaders at the [[Catshuis]] to discuss the [[Ukrainian crisis]] and met with [[Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands|King Willem-Alexander]] at the [[Royal Palace of Amsterdam]].{{cite news|last1=Sweet|first1=Lynn|title=Obama guidance & press schedule, March 24, 2014: The Netherlands|url=http://chicago.suntimes.com/politics/7/71/168143/obama-guidance-press-schedule-march-24-2014-the-netherlands|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]''|date=March 24, 2014}}{{cite news|last1=Miller|first1=Zeke J.|title=Obama Tries to Reassure Jittery Allies on Foreign Trip|url=http://time.com/34889/obama-trip-pope-francis/|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]''|date=March 23, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Belgium}} [[Belgium]] |[[Waregem]],
[[Brussels]] |March 26–27 |In Brussels, President Obama attended a wreath-laying ceremony and toured the [[Flanders Field American Cemetery and Memorial]], before attending the [[United States–European Union relations#EU-US Summits|EU-US Summit]] with [[European Commission]] [[President of the European Commission|President]] [[José Manuel Barroso]] and [[European Council]] [[President of the European Council|President]] [[Herman Van Rompuy]] and meeting with [[NATO]] [[Secretary General of NATO|Secretary General]] [[Anders Fogh Rasmussen]]. President Obama also delivered a speech at the [[Centre for Fine Arts, Brussels|Centre for Fine Arts]], mainly regarding the [[2014 Crimean crisis]].{{cite news|title=Obama lashes out at Russia over Crimea during Brussels speech|url=http://rt.com/usa/obama-brussels-nato-crimea-469/|accessdate=March 30, 2015|publisher=[[RT (TV network)|RT]]|date=March 26, 2014}}{{cite news|last1=Cendrowics|first1=Leo|title=Barack Obama's first visit to Brussels to cost Belgium more than €10m|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/mar/24/barack-obama-visit-brussels-cost-belgium-10m|accessdate=March 30, 2015|publisher=''[[The Guardian]]''|date=March 24, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Italy}} [[Italy]]
{{flagicon|Vatican City}} [[Vatican City]] |[[Rome]],
[[Vatican City]] |March 27–28 |President Obama met with [[Pope Francis]] at Vatican City to discuss economic inequality,{{cite news|last1=Kuhnhenn|first1=Jim|last2=Winfield|first2=Nicole|title=Obama tells Pope Francis he is a 'great admirer'|url=https://news.yahoo.com/obama-tells-pope-francis-great-admirer-101935536--politics.html|accessdate=March 30, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=[[Yahoo! News]]|date=March 27, 2014}} before meeting with [[President of Italy|President]] [[Giorgio Napolitano]] and [[Prime Minister of Italy|Prime Minister]] [[Matteo Renzi]].{{cite news|title=Obama meets Renzi, Napolitano, Pope on busy day in Rome|url=http://www.ansa.it/english/news/vatican/2014/03/27/obama-has-50-minute-meeting-with-pope_aadda1af-d280-4b73-8655-9b9b9c412f0d.html|accessdate=March 30, 2015|publisher=[[Agenzia Nazionale Stampa Associata]]|date=March 27, 2014}} The President also toured the [[Colosseum]].{{cite news|last1=Crossley|first1=Lucy|title='Remarkable, unbelievable': Barack Obama in awe as he visits ancient Roman Colosseum in latest stop for European tour|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2591150/Remarkable-unbelievable-Barack-Obama-awe-visits-ancient-Roman-Colosseum-latest-stop-European-tour.html|accessdate=March 27, 2014|publisher=''[[Daily Mail]]''|date=March 30, 2015}} |- |{{flagicon|Saudi Arabia}} [[Saudi Arabia]] |[[Riyadh]] |March 28–29 |President Obama met with [[Abdullah of Saudi Arabia|King Abdullah]] to discuss regional security and political issues, including the [[Nuclear program of Iran|nuclear program]] of [[Iran]] and the [[Syrian Civil War]].{{cite web|title=White House Briefing on Obama’s Meeting with Saudi Arabia’s King|url=http://susris.com/2014/03/29/white-house-briefing-on-obamas-meeting-with-saudi-arabias-king/|publisher=[[Saudi-U.S. Relations Information Service]]|accessdate=March 30, 2015|date=March 29, 2014}} |} ==April== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/

Robot|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/tech/innovation/obama-gets-kick-out-soccer-playing-asimo-robot-n88631|accessdate=March 29, 2015|publisher=[[NBC News]]|date=April 24, 2014}} before attending a [[state Korea|President]] [[Park Geun-hye]] at the [[Blue House]] to discuss [[North Korea]]'s [[Nuclear power in North Korea|nuclear threat]] and the U.S.-Korea Free Trade Agreement. In the wake of the [[Sinking of the MV Sewol|sinking]] of the [[MV Sewol|MV ''Sewol'']], President Obama also presented President Park with the [[Flag of the United States|American flag]] that flew over the White House during the day of the disaster (April 16), as well as presenting a [[magnolia]] seed to the [[Danwon High School]], which victimized a number of the high school's students and teachers. The following day, the President met with American and Korean business leaders to discuss the trade and economic cooperation between the two countries and delivered remarks at [[Yongsan Garrison]].{{cite web|last1=Kim|first1=Ellen|title=President Obama’s Visit to South Korea|url=http://cogitasia.com/president-obamas-visit-to-south-korea/|publisher=[[Center for Strategic and trip|url=http://www.theoaklandpress.com/general-news/20140426/royal-welcome-for-obama-on-historic-malaysia-trip|accessdate=March 30, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[The Oakland Press]]''|date=April 26, 2014}} On April 27, President Obama visited the [[National Mosque of Malaysia]], before holding a bilateral meeting and a joint press conference with Prime Minister Najib at the [[Perdana Putra]] to discuss issues on trade, defense, and maritime security, as well as the United States' commitment to contributing to the [[Search for Malaysia Airlines Flight 370|search]] for [[Malaysia Airlines Flight 370]].{{cite news|title=Obama says US committed to providing assets for MH370 ocean search|url=http://www.themalaymailonline.com/malaysia/article/obama-says-us-committed-to-providing-assets-for-mh370-ocean-search|accessdate=March 30, 2015|publisher=''[[The Malay Mail]]''|date=April 27, 2014}} He also delivered remarks at the [[Malaysian Global Innovation and Creativity Centre]] and participated in the Young Southeast Asian Leaders Initiative Town Hall meeting at the [[University of Malaya]]. |- |{{flagicon|Philippines}} [[Philippines]] |[[Manila]],

{{flagicon|Illinois}} ''[[Illinois]]'' |[[Gary, Indiana|Gary]],
[[Chicago]] |October 1–2 |President Obama arrived at [[Gary/Chicago International Airport]] in Gary, Indiana,{{cite news|title=Gary mayor asks Obama for longer visit next time|url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2014/oct/2/gary-mayor-asks-obama-for-longer-visit-next-time/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[The Washington Times]]''|date=October 2, 2014}} where he proceeded to Chicago to attend a fundraising event for [[Governor of Illinois|Governor]] [[Pat Quinn (politician)|Pat Quinn]], before delivering a speech on the economy at [[Northwestern University]].{{cite news|title=President Obama To Visit Northwestern For Speech On The Economy|url=http://chicago.cbslocal.com/2014/10/02/president-obama-to-visit-northwestern-for-speech-on-the-economy/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[CBS]]|date=October 2, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Indiana}} ''[[Indiana]]'' |[[Princeton, Indiana|Princeton]] |October 3 |President Obama visited the [http://www.millenniumsteelservice.com/ Millennium Steel Service] plant to deliver remarks on manufacturing and its effect on the economy.{{cite news|last1=Swiatek|first1=Jeff|title=President Obama touts strength of manufacturing in Indiana speech|url=http://www.indystar.com/story/money/2014/10/03/white-house-caller-surprised-southern-indiana-businessman/16612801/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[The Indianapolis Star]]''|date=October 3, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|New York}} ''[[New York (state)|New York]]'' |[[New York City]] |October 7 |President Obama attended two Democratic National Committee events.{{cite news|last1=Lederman|first1=Josh|title=Obama visits NYC, Conn. Tuesday|url=http://www.myfoxny.com/story/26721979/obama-visit-nyc|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=[[WNYW]]|date=October 7, 2014}}{{cite news|last1=Sweet|first1=Lynn|title=Obama guidance, schedule, Oct. 7, 2014: NYC for Dem fundraisers|url=http://chicago.suntimes.com/politics/7/71/154709/obama-guidance-schedule-oct-7-2014-nyc-for-dem-fundraisers|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]''|date=October 7, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Massachusetts}} ''[[Massachusetts]]'' |[[Greenwich, Massachusetts|Greenwich]] |October 7 |President Obama attended a fundraising event for the Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee.{{cite news|last1=Vigdor|first1=Neil|title=Obama draws Democratic supporters in Greenwich|url=http://www.ctpost.com/local/article/Obama-draws-Democratic-supporters-in-Greenwich-5807942.php#page-1|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[Connecticut Post]]''|date=October 8, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|California}} ''[[California]]'' |[[Los Angeles County]],
[[San Francisco]] |October 9–11 |President Obama attended a town hall meeting on the economy at [http://www.crosscamp.us/ Cross Campus] in [[Santa Monica, California|Santa Monica]] and a fundraising event for the Democratic National Committee at the residence of actress [[Gwyneth Paltrow]] in [[Brentwood, Los Angeles|Brentwood]].{{cite news|title=Obama Hails "Millennials" as Driving Force in Rebuilding Economy|url=http://www.nbclosangeles.com/news/local/President-Barack-Obama-Fundraiser-Economic-Plan-Los-Angeles-Visit-Gwyneth-Paltrow-278692351.html|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[The Wire Report]]|publisher=[[KNBC]]|date=October 9, 2014}} The President also spoke at the [[Frank G. Bonelli Regional Park]] in [[San Dimas, California|San Dimas]] to declare [[San Gabriel Mountains National Monument|part]] of the [[San Gabriel Mountains]] a [[National Monument (United States)|National Monument]].{{cite news|title=President Obama declares part of San Gabriel Mountains a national monument|url=http://abc7.com/hobbies/president-obama-declares-part-of-san-gabriel-mountains-a-national-monument/345448/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[KABC-TV]]|date=October 10, 2014}} In San Francisco, President Obama attended a round table discussion and a fundraising event for the Democratic National Committee at the residence of [[Zynga]] co-founder [[Mark Pincus]].{{cite news|title=President Obama Wraps Up San Francisco Fundraising Trip|url=http://www.nbcbayarea.com/news/local/President-Obama-in-San-Francisco-Friday-for-DNC-Fundraisers-278739871.html|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[KNTV]]|date=October 11, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Illinois}} ''[[Illinois]]'' |[[Chicago]] |October 19–20 |President Obama attended a campaign rally for Governor Pat Quinn at the [[Chicago State University]], as well as a Democratic National Committee fundraising event. The President also cast an [[Early voting|early vote]] for the [[United States elections, 2014|2014 midterm elections]].{{cite news|title=Obama Fires Up Democrats, Urges Early Voting For Quinn|url=http://chicago.cbslocal.com/2014/10/20/obama-fires-up-democrats-urges-early-voting-for-quinn/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[CBS]]|date=October 20, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Wisconsin}} ''[[Wisconsin]]'' |[[Milwaukee]] |October 28 |President Obama delivered a speech at the campaign rally for [[Governor of Wisconsin|Governor]] [[Wisconsin gubernatorial election, 2014|candidate]] [[Mary Burke]] at the [[North Division High School (Milwaukee)|North Division High School]].{{cite news|last1=Newton-Small|first1=John|title=Obama Rallies Wisconsin Democrats for Mary Burke|url=http://time.com/3544687/barack-obama-mary-burke-governor-rally/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]''|date=October 29, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Maine}} ''[[Maine]]'' |[[Portland, Maine|Portland]],
[[Cape Elizabeth, Maine|Cape Elizabeth]] |October 30 |President Obama attended a fundraising event in Cape Elizabeth with [[United States House of Representatives|Representative]] [[Mike Michaud]], before attending a rally for Michaud's gubernatorial campaign at the [[Portland Exposition Building]].{{cite news|last1=Merrill|first1=Paul|title=President Obama visits Maine|url=http://www.wmtw.com/politics/obama-to-rally-for-michaud-in-portland/29426604|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[WMTW]]|date=October 30, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Rhode Island}} ''[[Rhode Island]]'' |[[Providence, Rhode Island|Providence]] |October 30–31 |President Obama attended a round table discussion with faculty and students at [[Rhode Island College]], before delivering a speech regarding the economy and women.{{cite news|last1=McGee|first1=Sandy|title=Women, economy focus of President Obama RIC speech|url=http://wpri.com/2014/10/31/women-economy-focuse-of-president-obama-ric-speech/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[WPRI-TV]]|date=November 1, 2014}} |} ==November== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|Michigan}} ''[[Michigan]]'' |[[Detroit]] |November 1 |President Obama delivered a speech at the [[Wayne State University]] to campaign for [[United States Senator|Senator]] [[United States Senate election in Michigan, 2014|candidate]] [[Gary Peters (politician)|Gary Peters]] and [[Governor of Michigan|Governor]] [[Michigan gubernatorial election, 2014|candidate]] [[Mark Schauer]].{{cite news|title=Obama Rallies Wayne State Crowd To Vote For Schauer, Peters On Tuesday|url=http://detroit.cbslocal.com/2014/11/01/obama-rallies-wayne-state-crowd-to-vote-for-schauer-peters-on-tuesday/|accessdate=May 1, 2015|publisher=[[WWJ-TV]]|date=November 1, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|China}} [[China]] |[[Beijing]] |November 10–12 |President Obama attended the [[APEC China 2014|APEC summit]]. On November 11–12, the President held bilateral meetings with [[President of the People's Republic of China|President]] [[Xi Jinping]] to discuss [[China–United States relations]] and international and regional issues, as well as [[Comparison of US and Chinese Military Armed Forces|military relations]], the [[One-China policy]], [[climate change]], and terrorism.{{cite news|title=Xi, Obama walk and talk one-on-one in Beijing|url=http://www.cctv-america.com/2014/11/11/xi-obama-walk-and-talk-in-beijing-u-s-presidents-visit-to-china-continues-tomorrow|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[CCTV America]]|date=November 11, 2014}}{{cite news|title=US-China bilateral talks cover several major issues|url=http://www.cctv-america.com/2014/11/12/us-china-bilateral-talks-covers-several-major-issues|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Xinhua News Agency]]|publisher=[[CCTV America]]|date=November 12, 2014}} The President also met with [[Premier of the People's Republic of China|Premier]] [[Li Keqiang]],{{cite news|title=Li meets Obama, vowing to speed up BIT negotiations|url=http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/world/2014apec/2014-11/12/content_18904104.htm|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Xinhua News Agency]]|publisher=''[[China Daily]]''|date=November 12, 2014}} [[Australia]]n [[Prime Minister of Australia|Prime Minister]] [[Tony Abbott]],{{cite news|last1=Pace |first1=Julie |title=Obama tempers expectations for thaw with NKorea |url=http://home.cableone.net/news/read/category/AP%20Online%20-%20International%20News/article/the_associated_press-obama_nkorea_detainee_talks_not_about_nuke_issue-ap |accessdate=April 3, 2015 |agency=[[Associated Press]] |publisher=[[Cable One]] |date=November 10, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150407144503/http://home.cableone.net/news/read/category/AP%20Online%20-%20International%20News/article/the_associated_press-obama_nkorea_detainee_talks_not_about_nuke_issue-ap |archivedate=April 7, 2015 |df= }} and [[Indonesia]]n [[President of Indonesia|President]] [[Joko Widodo]].{{cite news|title=In China, Obama tests global clout post-election|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/ap/article-2827269/Asia-trip-tests-Obamas-postelection-global-clout.html|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[Daily Mail]]''|date=November 10, 2014}}{{cite web|title=The President’s Trip to China, Burma and Australia |url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/issues/foreign-policy/asia-trip-2014 |website=[[WhiteHouse.gov]] |accessdate=April 3, 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151108004027/https://www.whitehouse.gov/issues/foreign-policy/asia-trip-2014 |archivedate=November 8, 2015 |df= }} |- |{{flagicon|Burma}} [[Burma|Myanmar (Burma)]] |[[Naypyidaw]],
[[Yangon]] |November 12–14 |In Naypyidaw, President Obama attended the [[Ninth East Asia Summit|East Asia Summit]] and the U.S.-[[Association of Southeast Asian Nations|ASEAN]] summit meeting.{{cite news|last1=Lederman|first1=Josh|title=Obama returns to Myanmar as country struggles with democratic transition|url=https://www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/obama-meets-myanmar-leader-amid-fears-backslide/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[PBS NewsHour]]''|date=November 13, 2014}}{{cite news|last1=Herman|first1=Steve|title=Obama in Myanmar for ASEAN Meetings|url=http://www.voanews.com/content/asean-summit-opens-in-myanmar/2516846.html|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[Voice of America]]|date=November 12, 2014}} He met with [[President of Burma|President]] [[Thein Sein]] to discuss [[2011–12 Burmese political reforms|Burma's democratic reforms]] and also held a bilateral meeting with [[Vietnam]]ese [[Prime Minister of Vietnam|Prime Minister]] [[Nguyễn Tấn Dũng]].{{cite news|title=Obama backs Suu Kyi bid to change constitution|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-2834271/Obama-backs-Suu-Kyi-bid-change-constitution.html|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=''[[Daily Mail]]''|date=November 14, 2014}}{{cite news|last1=Pace|first1=Julie|title=Myanmar troubles jeopardize a big Obama goal|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/ap/article-2830996/Obama-confront-shortcomings-Myanmar-reforms.html|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=''[[Daily Mail]]''|date=November 13, 2014}} The President attended a round table discussion with members of the [[Assembly of the Union]], Speaker [[Shwe Mann]] of the [[House of Representatives (Burma)|House of Representatives]], Speaker [[Khin Aung Myint]] of the [[House of Nationalities]], and [[Opposition (Myanmar)|Opposition]] Leader [[Aung San Suu Kyi]] to further discuss Burma's democratic reforms.{{cite web|title=Remarks by President Obama After Roundtable at Parliamentary Resource Center|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2014/11/13/remarks-president-obama-after-roundtable-parliamentary-resource-center-n|website=[[WhiteHouse.gov]]|accessdate=April 3, 2015|date=November 13, 2014}} In Yangon, President Obama held a bilateral meeting with Suu Kyi at [[54 University Avenue|her residence]], which was followed by a joint press conference,{{cite news|title=Barack Obama Holds Talks With Myanmar Democracy Champion Aung San Suu Kyi|url=http://www.ndtv.com/world-news/barack-obama-holds-talks-with-myanmar-democracy-champion-aung-san-suu-kyi-696954|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Agence France-Presse]]|publisher=[[NDTV]]|date=November 14, 2014}} before participating in the Young Southeast Asian Leaders Initiative Town Hall meeting at the [[University of Yangon]].{{cite web|title=Remarks by President Obama at Young Southeast Asian Leaders Initiative Town Hall, 11/14/14|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2014/11/14/remarks-president-obama-young-southeast-asian-leaders-initiative-town-ha|website=[[WhiteHouse.gov]]|accessdate=April 3, 2015|date=November 14, 2014}} Additionally, the President had toured the [[Ministers' Building]] and attended a round table discussion with [[civil society]] organizations at the [[Embassy of the United States, Rangoon|United States Embassy in Yangon]].{{cite news|author1=Kyaw Phyo Tha|title=Obama Visits Site of Burmese Independence in Rangoon|url=http://www.irrawaddy.org/multimedia-burma/obama-visits-site-burmese-independence-rangoon.html|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[The Irrawaddy]]''|date=November 14, 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150403085030/http://www.irrawaddy.org/multimedia-burma/obama-visits-site-burmese-independence-rangoon.html|archivedate=April 3, 2015|df=}}{{cite web|title=Remarks by President Obama After Civil Society Roundtable|url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2014/11/14/remarks-president-obama-after-civil-society-roundtable|website=[[WhiteHouse.gov]]|accessdate=April 3, 2015|date=November 14, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Australia}} [[Australia]] |[[Brisbane]] |November 15–16 |President Obama attended the [[2014 G20 Brisbane summit|G20 summit]] held at the [[Brisbane Convention & Exhibition Centre]].{{cite news|last1=Taylor|first1=Lenore|title=G20: Barack Obama uses visit to reassert US influence in Asia Pacific|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/nov/15/g20-barack-obama-uses-visit-to-reassert-us-influence-in-asia-pacific|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[The Guardian]]''|date=November 15, 2014}} The President also held a trilateral meeting with Prime Minister Tony Abbott and [[Japan]]ese [[Prime Minister of Japan|Prime Minister]] [[Shinzō Abe]] to discuss [[Russia]]'s [[Annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation|annexation]] of [[Crimea]] and delivered a speech at the [[University of Queensland]] regarding [[youth voice]].{{cite news|last1=Spetalnick|first1=Matt|last2=Siegel|first2=Matt|title=U.S., Japan and Australia vow to oppose Russian action in Crimea|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/11/16/us-g20-summit-trilateral-idUSKCN0J000L20141116|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=November 15, 2014}}{{cite web|title=President Obama inspires students with landmark speech|url=http://www.uq.edu.au/news/article/2014/11/president-obama-inspires-students-landmark-speech|publisher=[[University of Queensland]]|accessdate=April 3, 2015|date=November 16, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Nevada}} ''[[Nevada]]'' |[[Las Vegas]] |November 21 |President Obama delivered a speech at the [[Del Sol High School]] to discuss his [[Immigration reform#Obama's executive actions of November 2014|executive plans for an immigration reform]].{{cite news|last1=Lee|first1=Brianna|title=Immigration: Obama Las Vegas Speech Pressures Congress, #PassABill Trends On Twitter|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/immigration-obama-las-vegas-speech-pressures-congress-passabill-trends-twitter-1727873|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[International Business Times]]''|date=November 21, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Illinois}} ''[[Illinois]]'' |[[Chicago]] |November 25 |President Obama spoke at the [[Gateway Theatre (Chicago)|Mitchell P. Kobelinski Theater]] to promote his executive plans for an immigration reform.{{cite news|last1=Schulte|first1=Sarah|title=Pres. Obama in Chicago to talk immigration policies|url=http://abc7chicago.com/politics/pres-obama-in-chicago-to-talk-immigration-policies/411041/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=[[WLS-TV]]|date=November 25, 2014}} |} ==December== {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=100|Country/
''U.S. state'' ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=60|Date(s) ! width=550|Details |- |{{flagicon|Maryland}} ''[[Maryland]]'' |[[Bethesda, Maryland|Bethesda]] |December 2 |President Obama met with injured troops at the [[Walter Reed National Military Medical Center]],{{cite news|last1=Sweet|first1=Lynn|title=Obama guidance, press schedule Dec. 2, 2014. Hagel, Ebola|url=http://chicago.suntimes.com/politics/7/71/213947/obama-guidance-press-schedule-dec-2-2014-hagel-ebola|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]''|date=December 2, 2014}} before touring the [[National Institutes of Health]], where he spoke on the efforts to fighting the [[Ebola virus epidemic in West Africa|Ebola virus epidemic]] in [[West Africa]].{{cite news|title=President Obama talks about Ebola at NIH|url=http://www.wusa9.com/story/news/health/2014/12/02/president-obama-nih-bethesda-md-visit-about-ebola/19771917/|accessdate=April 3, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=[[WUSA (TV)|WUSA]]|date=December 3, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|Tennessee}} ''[[Tennessee]]'' |[[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]] |December 9 |President Obama delivered remarks at [http://www.casaazafran.org/ Casa Azafrán] to discuss his executive plans for an immigration reform.{{cite news|last1=Zezima|first1=Katie|last2=Nakamura|first2=David|title=Obama takes pitch for immigration reform to Nashville|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/why-nashville-is-the-backdrop-for-obamas-immigration-pitch/2014/12/09/cfeaea10-7f71-11e4-9f38-95a187e4c1f7_story.html|accessdate=April 3, 2015|publisher=''[[The Washington Post]]''|date=December 9, 2014}} |- |{{flagicon|New Jersey}} ''[[New Jersey]]'' |[[Joint Base McGuire–Dix–Lakehurst]] |December 15 |President Obama spoke to American troops returning from [[Afghanistan]] at Joint Base McGuire–Dix–Lakehurst.{{cite news|title=UPDATES: Obama thanks troops at Joint page.title: List of time zones by country

revision.text:
{{see also|Daylight saving time by country}} This is a list representing '''[[time zone]]s by country'''. Countries are ranked by total number of time zones on their territory. Time zones of a country include that of [[dependent territories]] (except [[Territorial claims in Antarctica|Antarctic claims]]). [[France]], including its overseas territories, has the most time zones with 13. Many countries have [[daylight saving time]], one added hour during the local summer, but this list does not include that information. The [[Coordinated Universal Time|UTC]] offset in the list is not valid in practice during daylight saving time. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Sovereign state ! data-sort-type=number | No. of time zones ! Time zone ! Notes |- |{{flag|France}} || 12 ||[[UTC−10:00]] — most of [[French Polynesia]]
[[UTC−09:30]] — [[Marquesas Islands]]
[[UTC−09:00]] — [[Gambier Islands]]
[[UTC−08:00]] — [[Clipperton Island]]
[[UTC−04:00]] ([[Atlantic Standard Time Zone|AST]]) — [[Guadeloupe]], [[Martinique]], [[Saint Barthélemy]], [[Saint Martin (France)|Saint Martin]]
[[UTC−03:00]] (PMST) — [[French Guiana]], [[Saint Pierre and Miquelon]]
[[UTC+01:00]] ([[Central European Time|CET]]) — [[Metropolitan France]]
[[UTC+03:00]] — [[Mayotte]]
[[UTC+04:00]] — [[Réunion]], [[Crozet Islands]], [[Scattered Islands in the Indian Ocean]]
[[UTC+05:00]] — [[Kerguelen Islands]], Îles Saint-Paul and Nouvelle-Amsterdam
[[UTC+11:00]] — [[New Caledonia]]
[[UTC+12:00]] — [[Wallis and Futuna]] | [[Time in France]] |- |{{flag|Russia}} ||11|| [[UTC+02:00]] ([[Kaliningrad Time]]) — [[Kaliningrad Oblast]]
[[UTC+03:00]] ([[Moscow Time]]) — Most of European Russia and all [[Russian Railways|railroads throughout Russia]]
[[UTC+04:00]] ([[Samara Time]]) — [[Astrakhan Oblast]], [[Samara Oblast]], [[Saratov Oblast]], [[Udmurtia]], and [[Ulyanovsk Oblast]]
[[UTC+05:00]] ([[Yekaterinburg Time]]) — [[Bashkortostan]], [[Chelyabinsk Oblast]], [[Khanty–Mansia]], [[Kurgan Oblast]], [[Orenburg Oblast]], [[Perm Krai]], [[Sverdlovsk Oblast]], [[Tyumen Oblast]], and [[Yamalia]]
[[UTC+06:00]] ([[Omsk Time]]) — [[Omsk Oblast]]
[[UTC+07:00]] ([[Krasnoyarsk Time]]) — [[Altai Krai]], [[Altai Republic]], [[Kemerovo Oblast]], [[Khakassia]], [[Krasnoyarsk Krai]], [[Novosibirsk Oblast]], [[Tomsk Oblast]], and [[Tuva]]
[[UTC+08:00]] ([[Irkutsk Time]]) — [[Republic of Buryatia|Buryatia]] and [[Irkutsk Oblast]]
[[UTC+09:00]] ([[Yakutsk Time]]) — [[Amur Oblast]], western [[Sakha Republic]], and [[Zabaykalsky Krai]]
[[UTC+10:00]] ([[Vladivostok Time]]) — [[Jewish Autonomous Oblast]], [[Khabarovsk Krai]], [[Primorsky Krai]], and central [[Sakha Republic]]
[[UTC+11:00]] ([[Magadan Time]]) — [[Magadan Oblast]], eastern [[Sakha Republic|Sakha]], and [[Sakhalin Oblast]]
[[UTC+12:00]] ([[Kamchatka Time]]) — [[Chukotka Autonomous Okrug|Chukotka]] and [[Kamchatka Krai]]
| [[Time in Russia]] |- |{{flag|United States}} || 11 || [[UTC−12:00]] (unofficial) — [[Baker Island]] and [[Howland Island]]
[[UTC−11:00]] ([[Samoa Time Zone|ST]]) — [[American Samoa]], [[Jarvis Island]], [[Kingman Reef]], [[Midway Atoll]] and [[Palmyra Atoll]]
[[UTC−10:00]] ([[Hawaii–Aleutian Time Zone|HT]]) — [[Hawaii]], most of the [[Aleutian Islands]], and [[Johnston Atoll]]
[[UTC−09:00]] ([[Alaska Time Zone|AKT]]) — most of the state of [[Alaska]]
[[UTC−08:00]] ([[Pacific Time Zone|PT]]) — [[Pacific Time Zone#United States|Pacific Time zone]]: the Pacific coast states and [[Nevada]]
[[UTC−07:00]] ([[Mountain Time Zone|MT]]) — [[Mountain Time Zone#United States|Mountain Time zone]]: the [[Mountain states]] plus western parts of some adjacent states
[[UTC−06:00]] ([[Central Time Zone|CT]]) — [[Central Time Zone#United States|Central Time zone]]: a large area spanning from the [[Gulf Coast]] to the [[Great Lakes]]
[[UTC−05:00]] ([[Eastern Time Zone|ET]]) — [[Eastern Time Zone#United States|Eastern Time zone]]: roughly a triangle covering all the states from the Great Lakes down to Florida and east to the [[East Coast of the United States|Atlantic coast]]
[[UTC−04:00]] ([[Atlantic Standard Time Zone|AT]]) — [[Puerto Rico]], the [[U.S. Virgin Islands]]
[[UTC+10:00]] ([[Chamorro Time Zone|ChT]]) — [[Guam]] and the [[Northern Mariana Islands]]
[[UTC+12:00]] (unofficial) — [[Wake Island]], [[McMurdo Station]], and [[Amundsen–Scott South Pole Station]] | [[Time in the United States]] |- |{{flag|Antarctica}} || 9 || [[UTC−03:00]] ([[Time in Argentina|ART]]) — [[Palmer Station]], [[Rothera Station]]
[[UTC±00:00]] ([[Greenwich Mean Time|GMT]]) — [[Troll Station]]
[[UTC+03:00]] ([[Arabia Standard Time |UTC+03:00]]) — [[Syowa Station]]
[[UTC+05:00]] — [[Mawson Station]]

[[UTC+11:00]] — [[Casey Station]], [[Macquarie Island]]
[[UTC+12:00]] — [[McMurdo Station]]
| [[Time in Antarctica]] |- |{{flag|Australia}} || 9 || [[UTC+05:00]] — [[Heard and McDonald Islands]]
[[UTC+06:30]] — [[Cocos (Keeling) Islands]]
[[UTC+07:00]] ([[Christmas Island Time|CXT]]) — [[Christmas Island]]
[[UTC+08:00]] ([[Australian Western Standard Time|AWST]]) — [[Western Australia]], [[Indian Pacific]] railroad when travelling between [[Port Augusta]], South Australia and [[Kalgoorlie]], Western Australia) [[UTC+08:45]] (CWT) – [[South Australia]] ([[Border Village]]), [[Western Australia]] ([[Caiguna, Western Australia|Caiguna]], [[Eucla, Western Australia|Eucla]], [[Madura, Western Australia|Madura]], [[Mundrabilla, Western Australia|Mundrabilla]])
[[UTC+09:30]] ([[Australian Central Standard Time|ACST]]) — [[South Australia]], [[Northern Territory]], [[New South Wales]] ([[Yancowinna County]])
